Description: Pot. Shoulder sherd ridged above, glazed outside opaque blackish, purple and yellow in alternating stripes. Inside has thin greenish glaze. Fayyumi wares. Made of reddish earthenware.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Charles Drury Edward Fortnum (?)
Acquisition notes: Paper note accompanying object: "Fragments presented by C. Drun, Fortnum (1887), H. Wallis (1895), etc."
